questions.question_text: Which three actions are available for the container image scanning compliance rule? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
CDE verified on prisma.

Selected Answer: CDE
CDE

Tested on Prisma Cloud.
Compute > Defend / Compliance > Containers and images > Add rule > Ignore | Alert | Block

Selected Answer: CDE
Checked on Prisma Cloud

Selected Answer: B
B

The agentless scanning architecture lets you inspect a host and the container images in that host without having to install an agent or affecting its execution.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin-compute/agentless-scanning/onboard-accounts

choices.A: Agentless scan will automatically be disabled, so Defender scans are the only scans occurring.
choices.D: Both agentless and Defender scans will be disabled and an error message will be received.
choices.C: Defender scans will automatically be disabled, so agentless scans are the only scans occurring.
choices.B: Agentless scans do not conflict with Defender scans, so both will run.

questions.question_text: What will happen when a Prisma Cloud Administrator has configured agentless scanning in an environment that also has Host and Container Defenders deployed?

An administrator of Prisma Cloud wants to enable role-based access control for Docker engine.

Which configuration step is needed first to accomplish this task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B

To enforce role-based access control, Defender’s listener type must be set to TCP.

choices.B: Set Defender’s listener type to TCP.
choices.D: Configure Defender’s authentication sequence to first use an identity provider and then Console.
choices.C: Set Docker’s listener type to TCP.
choices.A: Configure Docker’s authentication sequence to first use an identity provider and then Console.

choices.B: indicates the most recent alert generated
choices.C: indicates when the data was ingested
choices.D: indicates when the data was aggregated for the results displayed

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D

The dashboard results include data for the last full hour. The timestamp on the bottom left corner of the screen indicates when the data was aggregated for the results displayed.

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin/prisma-cloud-compliance/compliance-dashboard

questions.question_text: Which of the below actions would indicate – “The timestamp on the compliance dashboard”?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D

Learning mode is the phase in which Prisma Cloud performs either static or dynamic analysis. Because the model depends on behavioral inputs, images stay in learning mode for 1 hour to complete the model. After this 1 hour, Prisma Cloud enters a 'dry run' period for 24 hours to ensure there are no behavioral changes and the model is complete. If during these 24 hours, behavioral changes are observed, the model goes back to Learning mode for an additional 24 hours.

questions.question_text: During the Learning phase of the Container Runtime Model, Prisma Cloud enters a “dry run” period for how many hours?
